passages.1:1: The elder, to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in [the] truth.
passages.1:2: Dear friend, I pray you may prosper concerning everything and be healthy, just as your soul prospers.
passages.1:3: For I rejoiced exceedingly [when the]<note: *Here "[when]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("came") which is understood as temporal> brothers came and testified [to] your truth, just as you are walking in [the] truth.
passages.1:4: I have no greater joy than this: that I hear my children are walking in the truth.
passages.1:5: Dear friend, you act faithfully<note: Or "you act loyally"> [in] whatever you do for the brothers, {even though they are strangers}<note: Literally "and this strangers">.
passages.1:6: They have testified [to] your love before the church; you will do well to send them<note: Literally "whom"> on their way in a manner worthy of God.
passages.1:7: For they have gone out on behalf of the name, accepting nothing from the pagans.<note: That is, Gentile unbelievers (as opposed to Gentile Christians)>
passages.1:8: Therefore we ought to support such [people], so that we become fellow workers with [the] truth.
passages.1:9: I wrote something to the church, but Diotrephes, who wants to be first [among] them, does not acknowledge us.
passages.1:10: Therefore, if I come, I will call attention to {the deeds he is doing}<note: Literally "his deeds which he is doing">, disparaging us with evil words. And not being content with these, he does not receive the brothers himself, and he hinders those wanting [to do so] and throws [them] out of the church.
passages.1:11: Dear friend, do not imitate [what is] evil, but [what is] good. The one who does good is of God; the one who does evil has not seen God.
passages.1:12: Demetrius has been testified to by all, even by the truth itself. And we also testify [to him], and you know that our testimony is true.
passages.1:13: I have many things to write to you, but I do not want to write to you by means of ink and pen.
passages.1:14: But I hope to see you right away, and to speak {face to face}<note: Literally "mouth to mouth">.
passages.1:15: Peace [be] to you. The friends greet you. Greet the friends by name.
